metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1618 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 48.0.2564.82, does not ensure that a proper cryptographicallyRandomValues random number generator is used, which makes it easier for remote attackers to defeat cryptographic protection mechanisms via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1618` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
